means: 有（ have的过去式和过去分词 ）
Halt Amplitude Duration 暂停振幅宽度

sentence.Network_en: The house seemed muted, hushed as if it had been deserted.
sentence.Network_cn: 房子里似乎悄然无声，安静得好像已经没人在住一样。

sentence.Network_en: I had obtained the authentic details about the birth of the organization.
sentence.Network_cn: 我已经掌握了有关该组织诞生的可靠的详细资料。

sentence.Network_en: Barry had his nose put out of joint by Lucy's aloof sophistication.
sentence.Network_cn: 露西的冷淡与世故使得巴里十分不快。

... 多数 , 人间 , 上流社会的人 , 世 , 世界 , 世人 , 世事 , 世俗 , 舆 , 宇宙had 过去分词 , 已经come 到 , 发生 , 赴 , 接近 , 来 , 冒充 , 去 , 完成 , 由于 , 总共.
and then had to look away somehow ., 然而必须转移目光.
He had discovered that this noble family had died out and were forgotten ., 他发现了这个高贵的家族已全部绝灭并且被人们所遗忘.

list.abs: 过去过去完成式(had done) would have done 将来过去式(did) were to + v.  should +v. should / would + v. 第二大类:在表示请.
初中英语短语大全 ... 52．decide to do sth． 决定做某事 53．had better 最好 55．ask sb to do sth． 要求某人做某事.
英语六级高频短语，词组 - 豆丁网 ... go wrong 出错,出故障 had better 应该 had rather 宁愿.
Some of the witnesses had to run the gauntlet of television cameras and reporters ., 一些目击者不得不在众多电视摄像机和记者的围堵下穿行.
the only thing I had to do here was to add some details ., 只有一件事是我必须去做的 , 那就是添加更多的细节.

entry.def: Had is the past tense and past participle of have .

entry.tran: （had 有时代替 if 用于从句句首，表示某种情况可能发生但并未发生）
entry.def: Had is sometimes used instead of 'if' to begin a clause which refers to a situation that might have happened but did not. For example, the clause 'had he been elected' means the same as 'if he had been elected'.

example.ex: Had he succeeded, he would have acquired a monopoly...
example.tran: 要是他当时成功了，他就会取得垄断地位。

example.ex: Had I known what the problem was, we could have addressed it.
example.tran: 如果我当时知道问题出在哪里，我们就可以设法解决了。

entry.def: If you have been had, someone has tricked you, for example by selling you something at too high a price.

example.ex: If your customer thinks he's been had, you have to make him happy.
example.tran: 要是顾客感觉自己当了冤大头，你就得设法让他消气。

entry.def: If you say that someone has had it, you mean they are in very serious trouble or have no hope of succeeding.

example.ex: Unless she loses some weight, she's had it...
example.tran: 除非她减点儿肥，否则她就没戏了。

example.ex: He wants actors who can speak Welsh. Obviously I've had it.
example.tran: 他要的是会说威尔士语的演员。明摆着，我是没指望了。

entry.def: If you say that you have had it, you mean that you are very tired of something or very annoyed about it, and do not want to continue doing it or it to continue happening.

example.ex: I've had it. Let's call it a day...
example.tran: 我受不了了。今天就到这儿吧。

example.ex: I've had it with that kind of treatment of Americans.
example.tran: 我再也忍受不了那样对待美国人了。

auth_sentence.content: The Romans had their own names for similar instruments.
auth_sentence.res_content: The Romans had their own names for similar instruments.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Romans had their own names for similar instruments.

auth_sentence.content: He also said Saddam Hussein had no active WMD.
auth_sentence.res_content: He also said Saddam Hussein had no active WMD.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He also said Saddam Hussein had no active WMD.

auth_sentence.content: He would never have had it any other way.
auth_sentence.res_content: He would never have had it any other way.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He would never have had it any other way.
